article.name: Enable Protect Client Logging
article.title: Enable Protect Client Logging
article.body:
If you have been asked to send the logs to our support team for analysis, please ensure you can replicate the issue at least once after logging has been enabled. This action will ensure that the issue you may be experiencing is recorded in these logs and allow the support team to see this in more detail.

Versions 23.9 and Later

From versions 23.9 and later, logging should be enabled by default.

To check this and locate the logs, please follow the steps below:

  1. In Microsoft Outlook, navigate to File and then Egress option on the bottom-left side of the options, as shown in the screenshot below.
  2. Once on the Settings page on the right side of the screen, click Open log location in Explorer, which will open a folder.

  3. From the folder, attach all of the logs found in this location unless the support team asks you to provide a specific log file.

Versions Below 23.9

Logging can be enabled in Microsoft Outlook or via the registry key.

Option One: Outlook

To enable logging in Microsoft Outlook, follow the steps below:

  1. In Microsoft Outlook, under the File menu, select Egress.

  2. On the right side of the page, ensure that the Enable Logging check box is selected.

  3. After logging is enabled and the issue has been replicated, navigate back to where the logging was enabled and select the Open log location in Explorer option.
Note:Please attach all of the logs found in this location unless asked by a member of the support teams ask you to provide a specific log file.

Option Two: Registry Key

To enable logging by registry key, follow the steps below:

  1. Open Regedit.
    1. Click the Start button.
    2. In the Start menu, either in the Run or Search box, type "regedit" and press Return or Enter.
  2. Navigate to: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Egress\Switch and HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Wow6432Node\Egress\Switch
  3. Right-click in the white space on the right side of Regedit and create a DWORD called LoggingLevel, with a value of 4.

To retrieve the logs, navigate to: C:\Users\[USER]\AppData\Local\Temp\switch\logs

If using an RDS environment, please be aware that logging may instead be present in the following file location: C:\Users\[USER]\AppData\Local\switch\logs.

Note:Please attach all of the logs found in this location unless asked by a member of the support teams asks you to provide a specific log file.

images.alt:
This screen capture displays the Egress Add-in configuration pane accessed via the Microsoft Outlook Backstage view (File menu).

**Context and Navigation:**

*   The view is within Outlook, indicated by the title "Inbox - [Redacted] - Outlook" and the standardized left navigation panel, which is currently set to the highlighted **Egress** tab.
*   The surrounding menu structure includes standard Outlook options such as "Info," "Open & Export," "Save As," "Print," "Office Account," and "Options."

**Main Content (Egress Information):**

*   **Branding:** Features the blue and black "egress" logo.
*   **Account Status:** Displays redacted account information and a hyperlink: `https://switch.egress.com/ui`.
*   **Action Button:** A prominent button labeled **Sign Out** allows the user to disconnect the application.
*   **Version and Legal:** Displays the installed software version: **Version: 24.08.1833**. Detailed text includes copyright and legal disclaimers, noting that intellectual property rights are **© 2024 Egress Software Technologies IP Limited.** A link is provided: "Click to View Egress patents."

**Settings and Diagnostics Panel (Right Column):**

*   **Header:** Settings.
*   **Secure Messages:** A checkbox labeled **Click to view secure messages** (currently unchecked).
*   **Policy Status:** Shows the last update timestamp for application policies: **13/08/2024 16:08:06**.
*   **Diagnostics Tools (Hyperlinks):** Provides tools for troubleshooting and maintenance:
    *   **Refresh Policies**
    *   **Open log location in Explorer** (highlighted)
    *   **Send diagnostics**
images.context: e logs found in this location unless the support team asks you to provide a specific log file.

images.alt:
This image displays a user interface panel labeled **Settings**.

The configuration options include:
1.  A checkbox labeled **"Click to view secure messages"** (Status: Unchecked).
2.  A checkbox labeled **"Enable logging"** (Status: Checked).

Below the checkboxes are two blue, underlined, actionable hyperlinks:
1.  **Refresh Policies**
2.  **Open log location in Explorer**
images.context: right side of the page, ensure that the Enable Logging check box is selected.

images.alt:
The image displays a Windows File Explorer window showing the contents of a directory named `logs`.

**Context and Path:**
The full directory path, visible in the address bar, is: `AppData > Local > Temp > switch > logs`. A search bar, labeled "Search logs," is present on the right.

**UI Elements (Ribbon and Navigation):**
The ribbon interface is active. The main tabs are File (active), Home, Share, and View. The Home tab commands are visible, categorized under Clipboard, Organize, New, Open, and Select. The left navigation pane shows primary locations, with **Quick access** highlighted as the currently selected view.

**Content Pane (Details View):**
The primary content area displays a detailed list of files within the `logs` directory. A status bar at the bottom confirms **"15 items"** are listed.

**Data Display:**
The files are displayed using the Details view, featuring the following column headers:
1.  **Name:** Files follow a naming convention of `[application]-YYYYMMDD` (e.g., `sdxtray-20181213`, `outlook-20181214`).
2.  **Date modified:** Files are chronologically listed, dating from 13/12/2018 to 20/12/2018. This column is actively used for sorting (indicated by an upward arrow).
3.  **Type:** All listed files are specified as "Text Document."
4.  **Size:** File sizes range from 3 KB up to 136 KB.
images.context: nt in the following file location: C:\Users\[USER]\AppData\Local\switch\logs.
